entry.title: Friday Morning Report (Sartin Draw Fire Wildfire)
entry.summary: SARTIN DRAW FIRE UPDATE David Hamilton, Incident Commander Friday, September 1, 2017 Morning UpdateFire Situation: Local, State and Federal fire resources have been working diligently to slow and stop the progression of the Sartin Draw fire since it was initially reported. The fire has been progressing to the northeast. Fire resources are working to keep the fire east of the Tongue River, south of the 621 and 664 roads, west of Highway 59 and north of Beaver Creek, Beaver Stacy Roads and Merchant Cut Across. Dozerline is being reinforced with firing operations to increase depth to secure fireline. Engines, skidgines and hand crews are extinguishing heat along the fire perimeter and assisting with firing operations. There are no closures currently. Expect heavy fire vehicle traffic along the Tongue River Road and other surrounding roads near the fire.
